prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 1
Name: Jinxie Tenma
Description: The maid of Kyubi Manor and a friend of Trucy. She thinks I'm a demon.
Character 2
Name: The Amazing Nine-Tails
Description: A masked wrestler of unknown identity and origin. The nine-tailed cape he sports is the signature piece of his costume.
Character 3
Name: Damian Tenma
Description: Jinxie's father and the mayor of Tenma Town. He was found unconscious at the scene of the crime.
Character 4
Name: Rex Kyubi
Description: The deceased alderman of Nine-Tails Vale. His snow-white hair was particularly striking.
Character 5
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She apparently studied psychology while she was in Europe!
Character 6
Name: Phineas Filch
Description: The caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He says he was guarding the entrance at the time of the murder.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective investigating the murder in Nine-Tails Vale. He's a self-styled champion of justice and keeper of the peace.
Character 8
Name: Florent L'Belle
Description: Mayor Tenma's aide. He was supposedly in the foyer with Filch at the time of the murder.
Character 9
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A brilliant former defense attorney who is supposed to be in retirement...
Character 10
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Yokai Legend Scroll
Description: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox. [caption] Tenma Taro has black feathers, yellow talons. He does not wield any weapon. The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.
Evidence 2
Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.
Evidence 3
Name: Nine-Tails Flower
Description: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.
Evidence 4
Name: Special Edition Paper
Description: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Diagram
Description: A diagram showing the scene of the crime.
Evidence 6
Name: Foyer Diagram
Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.
Evidence 7
Name: Fox and Demon Statue
Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth. (2 pages.) A token of goodwill made in secret. Jinxie is now the only one who knows what the original looked like.
Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 8
Name: Golden Fur
Description: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood. [caption] The man in a beige suit is lying on a table with a spear inpaling him. The other man in a green suit is sitting in a sofa with blood on his head. Neither of them are wearing gloves.
Evidence 10
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
Description: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside. A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.
Evidence 11
Name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
Description: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.
Evidence 12
Name: Jinxie's Statement
Description: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.
Evidence 13
Name: TV Listings
Description: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster. [caption] At 3 PM, the program is "Temma Town Pro Wrestling". It is circled in red.
Evidence 14
Name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.
Evidence 15
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.
Evidence 16
Name: Village Superstitions
Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.
Evidence 17
Name: Forbidden Chamber Key
Description: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it. The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.
Evidence 18
Name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
Description: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.
Evidence 19
Name: Hand Cream
Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.
Evidence 20
Name: Forbidden Chamber Figure → Azuki Kozo Figure
Description: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time. A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Alderman Kyubi was murdered with a spear that had been on the wall.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 1
Testimony: The fingerprints of the defendant, Damian Tenma, were found on the murder weapon.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 2
Testimony: At the time, Alderman Kyubi was asleep from a drug he unwittingly ingested.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 3
Testimony: Mayor Tenma attacked his helpless victim, impaling him like a human shish kebob!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 4
Testimony: But the sudden pain jolted the victim awake, and he grabbed a statue and struck back!
Person: Fulbright

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. 

First, I'll go through the characters, evidences, and testimonies provided. The key is to find a discrepancy between what a testimony claims and what an evidence states.

Looking at the testimonies from Bobby Fulbright:

Testimony 0: The murder weapon was a spear from the wall.
Testimony 1: Damian Tenma's fingerprints are on the weapon.
Testimony 2: Kyubi was drugged and asleep.
Testimony 3: Tenma attacked him, impaling him with the spear, and Kyubi struck back with a statue.
Testimony 4: The victim was jolted awake by pain and struck back.

Now, looking at the evidences, particularly Evidence 7 (Fox and Demon Statue). The description says the statue was used as the bludgeon weapon. The mayor's blood was on it, but no fingerprints. The testimony says that Kyubi struck back with the statue, implying he used it, but the evidence states that the statue was the weapon used on the mayor. Wait, maybe the contradiction is in the murder weapon. 

Fulbright's Testimony 0 says the murder weapon was a spear on the wall. But Evidence 7 says the statue was the weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. If the murder was by a spear, but the statue was the actual weapon, that's a contradiction. Wait, but the autopsy (Evidence 14) says cause of death was a spear stab. Hmm, so maybe there's a discrepancy here. 

Wait, let me recheck the evidence descriptions. Evidence 7's full description says: "The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted." Wait, but the autopsy (Evidence 14) says Kyubi was stabbed with a spear. So the autopsy says the cause of death was a spear, but the statue was used to bludgeon the mayor. So the murder weapon might be the spear, but the statue was another weapon used? 

But Fulbright's Testimony 0 states the murder weapon was the spear from the wall. The autopsy (Evidence14) confirms the cause was the spear. However, Evidence7 says the statue was used to bludgeon the mayor. Wait, perhaps the mayor (Damian Tenma?) was the one hit with the statue? Wait, the mayor was found unconscious, but the victim is Alderman Kyubi. Wait, the characters: Character 3 is Damian Tenma (mayor), and Character4 is Rex Kyubi (deceased alderman). The autopsy (Evidence14) says Kyubi was stabbed with a spear. So the murder weapon is the spear. But Evidence7 says the statue was used to bludgeon the mayor (Tenma?), but Tenma was found unconscious. 

Fulbright's Testimony 3 says Tenma attacked Kyubi with the spear, then Kyubi grabbed a statue and struck back. So according to the testimony, the spear was the murder weapon, and the statue was used by Kyubi in self-defense, but the autopsy says Kyubi was killed by the spear. However, the statue's evidence says it was the weapon used on the mayor (Tenma?), but Tenma was found unconscious, not dead. 

Wait, maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 0 (spear as murder weapon) and Evidence7 (statue as the weapon used on the mayor, but the mayor wasn't the victim). Alternatively, perhaps the testimony claims Tenma's fingerprints were on the spear (Testimony1), but Evidence7 says the statue has no fingerprints. But that might not directly contradict.

Alternatively, Testimony4 says the victim (Kyubi) grabbed the statue and struck back, implying the statue was used by Kyubi. But Evidence7's description says the statue was the weapon used on the mayor (Tenma), but Tenma was found unconscious, not dead. So maybe the testimony's account of the sequence contradicts the evidence about the statue's use.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence9 (Crime Photo): "The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth." Wait, maybe the spear was the murder weapon for Kyubi, but the statue was used on the mayor. The testimony says Tenma (mayor) attacked Kyubi with the spear, which matches the autopsy. But the statue's evidence is about the mayor being bludgeoned, but the mayor was found unconscious, not dead. So perhaps the testimony says Tenma used the spear on Kyubi, but the evidence says the mayor (Tenma) was hit with the statue. That would be a contradiction. Wait, if Tenma was the attacker (as per testimony), but the statue was used on him (the mayor), then that's conflicting. So the testimony claims Tenma attacked Kyubi with the spear, but the evidence suggests that Tenma (mayor) was the one hit with the statue. That would mean Tenma couldn't have been the attacker if he was hit with the statue. 

So Testimony3 says Tenma attacked Kyubi with the spear, but Evidence7 says the statue was used on the mayor (Tenma). Thus, the testimony claims Tenma was the attacker, but evidence shows he was the victim of the statue. That's a contradiction between Testimony3 and Evidence7. 

Alternatively, Testimony0 says the murder weapon was the spear, but the statue was used on the mayor (non-fatal?), but the murder was Kyubi via spear. So that's okay. But the contradiction would be between Testimony3 (Tenma used spear on Kyubi) and Evidence7 (statue used on Tenma). That would mean Tenma couldn't have been the attacker if he was hit. So that's the contradiction. 

Therefore, the conflicting pair is Evidence7 and Testimony3. The JSON should be {"evidence":7, "testimony":3}.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other here. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I have to pick one pair where they conflict.

Looking at the testimonies first, Filch (Character 6) is testifying. His testimony 3 says, "But I didn't see nothing outta the ordinary, no siree!" So he's claiming he didn't notice anything unusual when the murder happened after 3 PM. 

Now, checking the evidences. Evidence 13 is the TV Listings, which mentions that Filch's TV program guide had the 3 PM wrestling match circled in red. Also, in the dialogue with Apollo, Filch admits he watched that match, which was a disaster. If he was watching TV at 3 PM, then he couldn't have been on guard duty in the foyer as he claimed in his testimony. Because Testimony 2 says he was in his office keeping watch when the murder happened after 3 PM. 

So the contradiction is between Evidence 13 (TV Listings showing he watched TV at 3 PM) and Testimony 3 where he says he didn't see anything unusual. Wait, actually, the key point is that if he was watching TV, he wasn't on duty. The testimony 2 says he was in his office keeping watch, but if he was watching the TV program at 3 PM, that's conflicting. The evidence shows he was watching TV, so he couldn't have been on guard duty. Therefore, his testimony about not seeing anything (because he wasn't there) contradicts the evidence that he was watching TV instead of being on duty.

Wait, the exact testimonies are:

Testimony 2: "I was still in my office keeping a good watch when the murder happened after 3 PM."

But Evidence 13's TV Listings being circled and his admission to watching the match at 3 PM suggests he was watching TV then, not on duty. So the contradiction is between Testimony 2 and Evidence 13. But the user's question asks for one pair. Alternatively, maybe Testimony 3 and Evidence 13?

Alternatively, Testimony 3 says he didn't see anything, but if he was watching TV, he might have missed the murder. But the main contradiction is between his alibi (being on duty) and the evidence he was watching TV instead. The testimony 2 claims he was in the office on duty, but the evidence shows he was watching the program, so that's the conflict. 

Therefore, the correct pair would be Evidence 13 and Testimony 2. Wait, but the user's answer needs to be in the format like {"evidence": x, "testimony": y}. Let me check the numbers again. Evidence 13 is the TV Listings. Testimony 2 is Filch's statement about being in his office. 

So the contradiction is between Evidence 13 (TV Listings) and Testimony 2. Therefore, the answer should be {"evidence":13, "testimony":2}. 

Alternatively, maybe Testimony 3? Let me check again. Testimony 3 says he didn't see anything unusual, but if he was watching TV, he might not have been there to see anything. But the direct contradiction is between being on duty (testimony 2) versus watching TV (evidence 13). 

Yes, so the answer is evidence 13 and testimony 2.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through each piece of evidence and testimony carefully.

First, looking at the testimonies from Filch. Testimony 3 says, "If Tenma Taro was to pass by, his staff woulda gone jingle jangle." This implies that if Tenma Taro were present, there would be a noticeable sound from his staff. However, Testimony 4 states, "So ya see, there weren't no Tenma Taro in the foyer." Filch is asserting that Tenma Taro wasn't there because he would have heard the staff's jingle.

Now, looking at the evidence, specifically Evidence 12: Jinxie's Statement. It mentions that Jinxie saw a demon (presumably Tenma Taro) in the hallway near the crime scene and that it fled toward the foyer. This directly contradicts Filch's testimony that there was no Tenma Taro in the foyer. If Jinxie saw it heading to the foyer, but Filch claims it wasn't there, that's a contradiction.

Wait, but let me check other evidence too. Evidence 1 is the Yokai Legend Scroll, which describes Tenma Taro's appearance. Evidence 12 is the key one here because it's an eyewitness account of the demon going into the foyer. Filch's testimony says he wasn't there, so that's the conflict.

Another angle: Evidence 13 is the TV Listings, which shows Filch was watching the wrestling match at 3 PM. The autopsy report (Evidence 14) says the time of death was around 3:20 PM. If Filch was watching TV at 3 PM, maybe that's an alibi, but that's more about his location than the Tenma Taro presence.

The key contradiction is between Evidence 12 (Jinxie's Statement) and Filch's Testimony 4. The testimony denies Tenma Taro's presence in the foyer, while the evidence says Jinxie saw it going there. So the answer should be Evidence 12 and Testimony 4?

Wait, the question asks for one pair. Let me confirm again. The testimonies provided here are from Filch, Testimony 0 to 4. The user's last input includes Testimonies from Filch, and the question is about which evidence and testimony contradict each other.

So Testimony 4 (Filch says no Tenma Taro in the foyer) vs Evidence 12 (Jinxie says it went to the foyer). Therefore, the pair is Evidence 12 and Testimony 4. But the user wants the JSON in the format {"evidence": X, "testimony": Y}. Let me check the numbering again.

Looking back:

Testimonies listed here are from Filch's second set (since previous examples had different testimonies). The current Testimonies listed here are Testimony 0 to 4 from Filch. The Evidence 12 is Jinxie's Statement. So the contradiction is between Evidence 12 (says Tenma Taro was in foyer) and Testimony 4 (says there wasn't). Therefore, the correct pair is evidence 12 and testimony 4.
